intro: Gavilea gladysiae, commonly known as Gladys's gavilea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Chile. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, displaying a compact growth habit with lance-shaped leaves. Its blooming period occurs during the late winter to early spring, adding vibrant color to its natural environment. Gavilea gladysiae is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
